member.name: T:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1
member.summary: Represents a set of unique items
member.typeparam: Type of elements in the set

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._hashIndexFirstSlotIndex
member.summary: Contains the first slot number for each hash code

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._slots
member.summary: Slots used to store element data and hash codes

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._numUsedSlots
member.summary: The number of slots that are in use (i.e. filled with data) or have been used and marked as empty later on. This differs from _slots.Length, as not all of the array will be in use.

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._nextEmptySlotIndex
member.summary: The index of the first slot in the empty slots chain. Remove() prepends the cleared slot to the empty chain. Add() fills the first slot in the empty slots chain with the added element (or increases the number of touched slots if the empty slots chain is empty).

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._count
member.summary: The number of items in this set

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._comparer
member.summary: Equality comparer for elements in the set

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._numChangesMade
member.summary: The number of changes made to this set. Used by enumerators to detect changes and invalidate themselves.

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._throwExceptionOnDuplicateAdd
member.summary: Whether or not to throw exceptions when duplicate elements are added to the set

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._throwExceptionOnFailedRemove
member.summary: Whether or not to throw exceptions when elements are not removed

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._isReadOnly
member.summary: Whether or not this set is read-only

member.name: F:LAIR.Collections.Generic.Set`1._loadFactor
member.summary: Ratio of number of elements to the size of the hash index array. Values smaller than one result in quicker lookups and higher memory usage. Values larger than one result in slower lookups and lower memory usage.
